keywords.value: CIVIL WAR (THE WAR BETWEEN THE STATES)

docs.snippet: Among several plans named unofficially as entering into the scheme of the campaign is the establishment of two great camps, for the concentration and education of troops.
docs.lead_paragraph: Among several plans named unofficially as entering into the scheme of the campaign is the establishment of two great camps, for the concentration and education of troops.

docs.snippet: The steamship De Soto, Capt. JOHNSTON, arrived on the 20th from Havana, bringing a large number of passengers and a heavy mail. The De Soto left New-York on the 6th of May, arrived at Havana on 11th, and left on her return on the 16th.

headline.main: NEWS FROM HAVANA.; Arrival of the De Soto Mercantile Intelligence The Niagara and Huntsville Cruising for Privateers The W.H. Webb The Yacht Wanderer, & c.

headline.main: THE AFFAIR OF FORT SUMTER.; INTERESTING REPORT OF CONVERSATIONS BETWEEN HON. SCHUYLER COLFAX AND COL. ANDERSON.

headline.main: NOTES OF THE REBELLION.; MILITARY AFFAIRS IN OHIO. CAMP JACKSON THE COUNTRY BETWEEN COLUMBUS AND CAMP DENNISON SENTRIES ON DUTY DESCRIPTION OF THE CAMP A SUBSTANTIAL CAMP BREAKFAST ZOUAVES THE DRAUGHTSMAN COOK OF THE SEVENTH CINCINNATI AND THE BURNETT HOUSE ARRIVAL OF COL. ANDERSON, THE HERO OF SUMTER HIS APPEARANCE KENTUCKY AND THE UNION A NIGHT IN KENTUCKY NEW PORT BARRACKS HON. TOM MARSHALL THE BLOCKADE.

headline.main: THE SECESSION REBELLION.; The Condition of Affairs in and Around Washington. Death of Col. Vosburgh of the Seventy-First. SANITARY CONDITION OF THE TROOPS. Arrival of Mississippi and Alabama Troops at Harper's Ferry. THE SMALL-POX BROKEN OUT THERE. What is Doing at Fortress Monroe. The Rebel Battery at Sewell's Point Shelled. The Blockade of Charleston Raised Temporarily. Com. Tatnall in Command of the South Carolina Navy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Col. VOSBURGH, Commandant of the Seventyfirst Regiment, New-York, died at the Navy-yard about half past eight o'clock this morning. He was attacked with bleeding from the lungs only last Friday. His remains will be taken to New-York under escort of a detachment from his late command.

docs.snippet: SEWER ACCIDENT. Two men were instantly killed, on Saturday evening, by the caving in of a sewer bank, where they were, on Jay, near Yorkstreet. There were several other men who narrowly escaped losing their lives. The names of those killed were Owen...
docs.lead_paragraph: SEWER ACCIDENT. Two men were instantly killed, on Saturday evening, by the caving in of a sewer bank, where they were, on Jay, near Yorkstreet. There were several other men who narrowly escaped losing their lives. The names of those killed were Owen BRACKEN and MICHAEL CLARK. Coroner HORTON held an inquest, and the Jury rendered a verdict that their death was the result of accidental causes.
